Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2009 02:21AM kathym32066 wrote: Thank you so much for your reply.  My Dr. does know it is not a cyst, at least that is what he told me.  The lump is sollid and hard to the touch.  From what I understand, cysts are less firm.  I've been up since 4am, can't seem to sleep very well.  I do know the last time this happened it took around 4 months between tests and surgery before I had peace of mind and found out it was benign.  Thank you for your prayers, it is most appreciated!!!  I am praying for all of you wonderful supportive women as well.
Posts.Title: Hi, my name is Kathy kathym32066 IowaDiva

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2009 03:40AM kathym32066 wrote: Hi Leaf, yes, it is awful, the waiting is agonizing.  Your right about the percentages, believe me, the first lump I found I researched and researched.  I'm 43, and on know the odds are on my side.  I actually wasn't too concerned when the found the first two nodules on the right side, and I did get more concerned when I felt the lump on the left.  It was the discharge along with the lump that has now got me into a panic. Yes, I have moved very quickly on this as I do with everything else in life.  Always better to be safe then sorry and be strong about anything in life and take the bull by the horns and just do what we must do.  Thank you so much for your response Leaf!  I hope to come back with a B9 diagnosis...  Hugs!
Posts.Title: Hi, my name is Kathy kathym32066 IowaDiva

Posts.Content: kathym32066 wrote: about 4 years ago I found a lump, had surgery and it was thankfully benign.  I just went for my mammo and I was told that they found 2 small nodules in my upper right breast.  I was told to follow-up in 6 months.  about 2 weeks after being told this, my husband found a lump in my left breast.  It  feels different from the first lump found 4 years ago. More firmly in place.  I also have discharge when I squeeze the nipple.  I am set up to have diagnostic testing tomorrow.   I have to say, I am a bit scared because of the discharge and the lump combined together.  Why wasn't this seen on the mammo 2 weeks prior?   It is a nice size lump. I would appreciate any thoughts on my situation.  Do you think this time around it sounds more likely to be cancer?  I'm so scared that it might be.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hi, my name is Kathy kathym32066 IowaDiva
